moves.1. e4: ?? The Losing move! would it not be simpler to play 1.Kxe8? ;)
moves.1... Nf6: Interesting opening. Why would the Master Mater play an opening where,even himself admits,is hard to acheive an early mate? Simple. Most players don't know this opening in-depth. I feel that I am lucky that I played it a little before! I also did not use the GK Database for this game to see how much I knew about this opening
moves.4... Nc6: a popular alternative is 4...Bg4 but this is completely fine.
moves.5... Nb6 6. exd6 exd6: opting for a more symmetrical approach.
moves.7. Be2 Be7 8. O-O O-O 9. Nc3 Bf6 10. Be3: After the opening skirmish. Both sides are completely fine. They have developed all of their pieces and castled.
moves.11. a3: with the LSB on the b1-h7 diagonal. an eventual ...Nb4 can be troublesome
moves.11... d5: getting the typical strike back in the center
moves.12. cxd5 Ne7: a zwicshenzug (have no clue how to spell this) of sorts. No need to recapture just yet.
moves.13. d6: knowing that the pawn is a goner,I decide to draw his Queen out
moves.13... Qxd6 14. Nb5 Qd8 15. Bf4: loading all of the pressure on c7
moves.15... Ned5: killing three birds with one stone. The Knight rests on its ideal place in front of the isolated pawn and covering c7. It also attacks the Bishop
moves.16. Bg3 Be7 17. Bd3 Bxd3 18. Qxd3 Qd7: I was still satisfied with my position at this point.
moves.19. Nc3 Rad8 20. Ne5: Taking the jump to a good outpost and still forcing the Queen to move
moves.20... Qe6 21. Rfe1: At this point in the last game,I was mated by Freddy. I follow the advice of placing the Rook on the same file as the Queen for a possible discovery later on
moves.21... Rfe8 22. Nc4 Qd7 23. Nxb6: Possibly a little mistake,relieving the tension
moves.24. Nb5:
?! a dubious move. The "weakness" that I thought was on c7 was just an illusion.

Computer: 24. Rad1!? =
moves.24... c6 25. Bc7:
? It's better to go through with my original plan 25. Nc7,just losing a pawn.

Computer:25. Nc7 Rf8 26. Rad1 -/+
moves.25... cxb5 26. Bxd8 Rxd8: the weakness on d4 now shows. Perhaps I shouldn't have traded too much?
moves.27. b3: to prevent the knight from going to c4.
moves.31. Rac1 Nc3: the knight ends up gaining an outpost on the c-file and it cripples my position even more
moves.34... Qf7 35. g4: blindly missing the threat. After I get down against higher-rated players I lose it. This is probably bordering masochism.
moves.41... Ne2+ 42. Rxe2 Qxe2 43. Rc8+: Making checks to make the game last longer
All in all, a better effort than my last game vs. Freddy. But it was not enough

gameName: 2nd  attempt to mate the Master Mater
